data.title: a part of history!
data.text: My daughter and i visited Pittsburgh for a Steelers game the first weekend of Oct '16.  We wanted to see the William Penn Hotel, and go to the Speakeasy and the Tap Room.  Speakeasy was closed as it was a monday,,Tap Room - very nice - food good, try the pierogies,,,the grilled cheese pannini was delicious!!  Drinks great!! - Bob the bartender was also our waiter - has been there 30 yrs - many stories!!, nice chatting with you bob / it's their 100th anniversary, theres many pictures downstairs of past celebrations, Bob pointed out a carved roof right outside the Tap Room, that he watched them work on , his first day at the William Penn,,i would definitely go again if i ever make it to Pittsb, just sorry we missed the Speakeasy       Lobby is beautiful, as is the Palm Court area

data.title: Atmosphere, drinks, food
data.text: Stumbled upon this local favorite because we were staying in the hotel and we loved it.  Great chicken, nachos, burgers and fish and chips, as well as very good drinks.  Your money is well spent here and the staff is friendly, as are the patrons.  We came back repeatedly for a reason!  It was nice to be a part of the local scene and see wedding parties and regulars enjoying the games on the 4 TVs.

data.title: Good food
data.text: We ate here twice while staying across the street. First night our server forgot to put our appetizer in which was the mini calzone in so they comp it. Would have paid for them even know she forgot they were that good. Also got a smokehouse burger. Asked for it medium but came out more like well but still wasn't dry, my girlfriend got the turkey club which she enjoyed. For dessert we got the caramel apple cheesecake   which was out of this world. Second night we got food togo. I tried the grilled chicken sandwich on olive bread. It was great

data.title: Hidden gem
data.text: This was my fourth time here. It's a hidden gem. It's in the Omni William Penn building. This place has great food and a good beer selection. A great place to go to avoid the crowds.

data.title: English Style Pub in William Penn Hotel
data.text:
Being from the Boston area I appreciate both Irish and English Pubs.  The Tap Room in downtown Pittsburgh is a good knock off of a British Pub sans darts.  

It is located on the first floor at rear of hotel below lobby level. It would be easy to stay at this hotel and not even know it was here.   I went on a Wednesday evening and there was a good crowd of both locals and hotel guests. 

There are flat screen TV s around and while I would not say this is a sports pub they have both local and ESPN sports available.  There are about 8 local brews on tap with a good variety as well as many more bottled.  There is a long lost of whiskey's and scotch offerings as well

I had a crispy wing appetites which was very good as well as a pub burger which was juicy and flavorful.   Pricing was reasonable and the bartender "Bob" is friendly and attentive. 

As I mentioned it is in the William Penn Hotel which is an Omni property.  It is a block from Steel Plaza subway and a five minute walk from Consol Center so easy to get to 

I would recommend.as a great place to grab a beer, sip some whiskey and enjoy good pub food.  The only thing I caution is that it is not that big so great not for large groups of say a dozen or more. I will definitely visit again.

data.title: Awesome beer and Great Food
data.text: What can I say? The fish and chips were out of this world, the beer variety was a bit sparse, but do-able, handicapped accessibility is non existent, unless you can maneuver steps with a cane, or have someone that can carry your walker, while you try your best to make it up and down the steps without falling.

data.title: Good spot for a casual lunch or dinner
data.text:
I grabbed a quick lunch here after a morning walking tour of downtown.  Leslie was a great server.  The margarita was large and refreshing.  I had the tuna melt which came on a pretzel roll.  I left the top portion behind because I think of tuna melts as open face.  It was a good sandwich.  I like that you can pick your side so I was able to get fresh fruit with it.  

The pub was cool and quiet and not terribly busy on a Saturday afternoon.  It delivered on what I was looking for.

data.title: Great food! Great Service
data.text: I had the roasted chicken with brussel sprouts and smashed potatoes recommended by our waitress.  While I waited she also suggested the Jalapeño Margarita. Ever

data.title: Good for lunch and drinks
data.text: The lunch we had here was fantastic!  Sandwiches are large and server was knowledgeable on the area so gave us some great sightseeing tips!

data.title: Great Place for Burger and Beer
data.text:
This restaurant is in the Omni William Penn, and a great place for quick beer and burger.  The prime grind burger is a great choice for a tasty burger (although pricy, it may really be worth it).  The beer, wine, and drink list is great (it is a bar).  The wait staff is well trained, courteous, no problems here. It is not a big place and when we went it was about 3/4 full (seating could be an issue on a busy night).

That prime grind burger may be worth a return trip, it was that good.

data.title: Nice place to eat
data.text: While at the Omni on business we had dinner here. It was very elegant. The food was amazing! It's truly an experience. The wait staff are exceptional!

data.title: Casual atmosphere with delicious food and prompt service!
data.text: Enjoyed this part of the hotel several times.  Food equaled the finer restaurants our tour hosts treated us to in the evenings as far as taste and quality. Casual atmosphere to stop by for food and drink, with several tvs available.

data.title: Good Beer, Better Staff!
data.text: You will find it hard to leave when you engage one of the staff in a bit of friendly conversation at the Tap Room. The ladies that waited our table each time we visited always had something new to share with us about the lay of the land in Pitt. Tips on things to do,, but most importantly, the different kinds of beer that the city offers. Overall, the food was good and so were the locally brewed beverages.

data.title: Quick casual dinner
data.text: The giant pretzel is awesome and could be a meal itself. I had the grilled cheese which was good but the fries were better.

data.title: Nice spot for late night drink
data.text: Dark paneled room with high/low top tables as well as the bar. Plenty of food options to go with the beverages. Full bar and beer.

data.title: Friendly, great food but expensive
data.text: Service is excellent and friendly, food is great but portions are huge so you could easily share. Loved the appetizers especially.

data.title: Good late meal
data.text: We ate a late dinner here recently. Area is small and we got last table. Waited on immediately by Leslie who was fantastic. Food is large portions, took a bit to arrive. Would recommend and return.

data.title: Had a hamburger - took quite while to arrive. Tasted good. Didn't want to leave the hotel.
data.text: Downtown Pittsburgh is depressing, but I am told that are nice areas (i.e. Carnegie-Mellon University area).

data.title: Late night visit
data.text: We were staying in the hotel and wanted to have drink before heading up for the night.  Please that there was a pub in our hotel...very convenient.  Decor was dark and layout was strange.  Drinks were fine but the food (we just tried the Cuban Quesadilla) was dry, lacked flavor and the dip was bbq sauce (mustard description was on the menu).  We would come back but not for the food.  Service was a bit slow.

data.title: cold beer
data.text: We stopped in the Tap Room for a few drinks before heading out.  The bartender Rob, was very nice and friendly.  The beer was cold and the atmosphere was very pleasant.  We didn't have food but would definitely go back for drinks.
